concept.title: Troubleshooting .NET Applications
concept.shortdesc: The .NET Framework does not find managed DLLs using the conventional PATH environment variable. In order for your assembly to find and load a managed DLL, it must either be loaded as a private assembly using assemblyBinding, or it must be installed into the Global Assembly Cache (GAC).

conbody.p: The GAC utility must be run on every machine that runs the .NET code.
If an assembly attempts to load the GemStone.GemFire.Cache.dll without meeting this requirement, you receive this System.IO.FileNotFoundException:
